noun.description: A sluggish, slow-witted, or unintelligent person; a dullard. Formerly also: †a worn-out or slow-moving horse or draught animal (obsolete).

verb.description: To move sluggishly; to go about something in a slow or sluggish manner; to dawdle.

origin: Mid 16th century. Origin uncertain<br>mid 18th century. Apparently a variant or alteration of dimble. Perhaps compare also dingle<br>late 16th century (in an earlier sense). Origin uncertain; probably ultimately an imitative formation in -le, although compare earlier drumble<br>mid 19th century. Apparently a blend of drum and rumble.
